cortex-debug.variableUseNaturalFormat.description: If true, display variables in their natural format as specified by ARM. Hex otherwise.

cortex-debug.liveWatchRefreshRate.description: GUI refresh frequency in milliseconds. Your sample rate can be much faster than refresh rate. VSCode UI cannot handle high refresh rates and your Live Watch window will look frozen. Do not recommend below 250ms as it will not be legible anyways. Anything below 200ms did not work at all for us

cortex-debug.armToolchainPath.description: Path to the GCC Arm Toolchain (standard prefix is "arm-none-eabi" - can be set through the armToolchainPrefix setting) to use. If not set the tools must be on the system path. Do not include the executable file name in this path.

cortex-debug.armToolchainPath.linux.description: Path to the GCC Arm Toolchain (standard prefix is "arm-none-eabi" - can be set through the armToolchainPrefix setting) to use. If not set the tools must be on the system path. Do not include the executable file name in this path.

cortex-debug.armToolchainPath.osx.description: Path to the GCC Arm Toolchain (standard prefix is "arm-none-eabi" - can be set through the armToolchainPrefix setting) to use. If not set the tools must be on the system path. Do not include the executable file name in this path.

cortex-debug.armToolchainPath.windows.description: Path to the GCC Arm Toolchain (standard prefix is "arm-none-eabi" - can be set through the armToolchainPrefix setting) to use. If not set the tools must be on the system path. Do not include the executable file name in this path.

cortex-debug.armToolchainPrefix.description: The prefix to use for the arm toolchain - the standard release from arm uses "arm-none-eabi" but alternative toolchains may use a different prefix. Currently the gdb, objdump and nm tools are needed.

cortex-debug.gdbPath.linux.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the GDB executable. This is useful for cases where your gdb executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-gdb format - for example `gdb-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path.

cortex-debug.gdbPath.osx.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the GDB executable. This is useful for cases where your gdb executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-gdb format - for example `gdb-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path.

cortex-debug.gdbPath.windows.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the GDB executable. This is useful for cases where your gdb executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-gdb format - for example `gdb-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path.

cortex-debug.gdbPath.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the GDB executable. This is useful for cases where your gdb executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-gdb format - for example `gdb-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path.

cortex-debug.objdumpPath.linux.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the objdump executable. This is useful for cases where your objdump executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-objdump format - for example `objdump-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

cortex-debug.objdumpPath.osx.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the objdump executable. This is useful for cases where your objdump executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-objdump format - for example `objdump-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

cortex-debug.objdumpPath.windows.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the objdump executable. This is useful for cases where your objdump executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-objdump format - for example `objdump-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

cortex-debug.objdumpPath.description: This setting allows you to completely override the path/executable for the objdump executable. This is useful for cases where your objdump executable doesn't follow the standard <tuple>-objdump format - for example `objdump-multiarch`. This can be just the executable name (if on the system path) or the full path. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

cortex-debug.JLinkGDBServerPath.description: Path to the JLink GDB Server. If not set then JLinkGDBServer (JLinkGDBServerCL.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.JLinkGDBServerPath.linux.description: Path to the JLink GDB Server. If not set then JLinkGDBServer (JLinkGDBServerCLExe) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.JLinkGDBServerPath.osx.description: Path to the JLink GDB Server. If not set then JLinkGDBServer (JLinkGDBServerCLExe) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.JLinkGDBServerPath.windows.description: Path to the JLink GDB Server. If not set then JLinkGDBServer (JLinkGDBServerCL.exe) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.openocdPath.description: Path to the OpenOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then openocd (openocd.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.openocdPath.linux.description: Path to the OpenOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then openocd (openocd.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.openocdPath.osx.description: Path to the OpenOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then openocd (openocd.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.openocdPath.windows.description: Path to the OpenOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then openocd (openocd.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.pyocdPath.description: Path to the PyOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then pyocd-gdbserver must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.pyocdPath.linux.description: Path to the PyOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then pyocd-gdbserver must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.pyocdPath.osx.description: Path to the PyOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then pyocd-gdbserver must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.pyocdPath.windows.description: Path to the PyOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then pyocd-gdbserver must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.PEGDBServerPath.description: Path to the PEMicro GDB Server. If not set then PEGDBServer (pegdbserver_console.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.PEGDBServerPath.linux.description: Path to the PEMicro GDB Server. If not set then PEGDBServer (pegdbserver_console.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.PEGDBServerPath.osx.description: Path to the PEMicro GDB Server. If not set then PEGDBServer (pegdbserver_console.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.PEGDBServerPath.windows.description: Path to the PEMicro GDB Server. If not set then PEGDBServer (pegdbserver_console.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stutilPath.description: Path to the Texane's ST-Util GDB Server executable. If not set then st-util (st-util.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stutilPath.linux.description: Path to the Texane's ST-Util GDB Server executable. If not set then st-util (st-util.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stutilPath.osx.description: Path to the Texane's ST-Util GDB Server executable. If not set then st-util (st-util.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stutilPath.windows.description: Path to the Texane's ST-Util GDB Server executable. If not set then st-util (st-util.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stlinkPath.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stlinkPath.linux.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stlinkPath.osx.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stlinkPath.windows.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stm32cubeprogrammer.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

cortex-debug.stm32cubeprogrammer.linux.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

cortex-debug.stm32cubeprogrammer.osx.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

cortex-debug.stm32cubeprogrammer.windows.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

cortex-debug.enableTelemetry.description: Enable Telemetry for the Cortex-Debug Extension. Reporting will also respect the global telemetry.enableTelemetry setting.

cortex-debug.dbgServerLogfile.description: Logs the contents of the gdb-server terminal. Use ${PID} in the file name to make it unique per VSCode session

commands.title: Toggle hex display in Variables window
Add expression to Live Watch window

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe, stlink, stutil, qemu, bmp and external. For "external", [please read our Wiki](https://github.com/Marus/cortex-debug/wiki/External-gdb-server-configuration)

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main attach sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main attach sequence has finished.

preRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the restart sequence (after interrupting execution).

postRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the restart sequence.

preResetCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the reset sequence (after interrupting execution). When not defined this will have the same value of preRestartCommands.

postResetCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the reset sequence. When not defined this will have the same value of postRestartCommands.

overrideAttachCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of attaching to a running target. In most cases it is preferable to use preAttachCommands and postAttachCommands to customize the GDB attach sequence.

overrideRestartCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of restarting the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preRestartCommands and postRestartCommands to customize the GDB restart sequence.

overrideResetCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of reset the target. When not defined this will have the same value of overrideRestartCommands. In most cases it is preferable to use preResetCommands and postResetCommands to customize the GDB reset sequence.

postStartSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the start sequence, after a debug session has already started and runToEntryPoint is not specified.

postRestartSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the re-start sequence, after a debug session has already started.

overrideGDBServerStartedRegex.description: You can supply a regular expression (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions) in the configuration property to override the output from the GDB Server that is looked for to determine if the GDB Server has started. Under most circumstances this will not be necessary - but could be needed as a result of a change in the output of a GDB Server making it incompatible with cortex-debug. This property has no effect for bmp or external GDB Server types.

cpu.description: CPU Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

machine.description: Machine Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

rtos.description: RTOS being used. For JLink this can be Azure, ChibiOS, embOS, FreeRTOS, NuttX, Zephyr or the path to a custom JLink RTOS Plugin library. For OpenOCD this can be auto (recommended), FreeRTOS, ThreadX, chibios, Chromium-EC, eCos, embKernel, linux, mqx, nuttx, RIOT, uCOS-III, or Zephyr.

armToolchainPath.description: This setting can be used to override the armToolchainPath user setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the path where arm-none-eabi-gdb, arm-none-eabi-objdump and arm-none-eabi-nm are located.

toolchainPrefix.description: This setting can be used to override the toolchainPrefix user setting for a particular launch configuration. Default = "arm-none-eabi"

serverpath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB Server path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. It is the full pathname to the executable or name of executable if it is in your PATH

gdbPath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the full pathname to the executable (or name of the executable if it is in your PATH). Note that other toolchain executables with the configured prefix must still be available.

objdumpPath.description: This setting can be used to override the objdump (used to find globals/statics) path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the full pathname to the executable (or name of the executable if it is in your PATH). Note that other toolchain executables with the configured prefix must still be available. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

serverArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB Server command line

executable.description: Path of executable for symbols and program information. See also `loadFiles`, `symbolFiles`

symbolFiles.description: List of ELF files to load symbols from instead of the executable file. Program information is ignored (see `loadFiles`). Can be an empty list to specify none. If this property does not exist, then the executable is used for symbols

file.description: Pathname of an ELF file for symbols

offset.description: Optional offset to apply to all sections of the ELF file. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

textaddress.description: Optional: Load the TEXT section at the specified 'textaddress'. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

address.description: Base address for section. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

gdbTarget.description: For externally (servertype = "external") controlled GDB Servers you must specify the GDB target to connect to. This can either be a "hostname:port" combination or path to a serial port

breakAfterReset.description: Applies to Restart/Reset/Launch, halt debugger after a reset. Ignored if `runToEntryPoint` is used.

runToEntryPoint.description: Applies to Launch/Restart/Reset, ignored for Attach. If enabled the debugger will run until the start of the given function.

numberOfProcessors.description: Number of processors/cores in the target device.

targetProcessor.description: The processor you want to debug. Zero based integer index. Must be less than 'numberOfProcessors'

liveWatch.description: An object with parameters for Live Watch

enabled.description: Enable/Disable Live Watch. Only applies to OpenOCD

samplesPerSecond.description: Maximum number of samples per second. Different from GUI refresh-rate, which is a user/workspace setting

chainedConfigurations.description: An object describing how additional configurations should be launched

enabled.description: Enable/Disable entire set of chained configurations

detached.description: Related or independent server sessions. Set to true for servers like 'JLink'. Inherited by children

lifecycleManagedByParent.description: Are Restart/Reset/Stop/Disconnect shared? All life-cycle management done as a group by parent/root. Inherited by children

waitOnEvent.description: Event to wait for. 'postStart' means wait for gdb-server connecting, 'postInit' is after init commands are completed by gdb. Inherited by children

delayMs.description: Default delay in milliseconds for a certain amount of milliseconds to begin launch. Inherited by children

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration. A set of name/value pairs. Set value to 'null' (no quotes) to delete. Sorry, no IntelliSense

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent. This is processed before any overrides. Sorry, no IntelliSense

name.description: Name of launch configuration. Sorry, no IntelliSense

folder.description: Folder to use for this configuration. Where .vscode/launch.json exists. Default is same folder as parent. Use either the full path name or the base-name of the folder

detached.description: Related or independent server sessions. Set to true for servers like 'JLink'

waitOnEvent.description: Wait for an event. 'postStart' means wait for gdb-server connecting, 'postInit' is after init commands are completed by gdb

delayMs.description: Delay in milliseconds for a certain amount of milliseconds to begin launch

lifecycleManagedByParent.description: Are Restart/Reset/Stop/Disconnect shared? All life-cycle management done as a group by parent/root

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration. A set of name/value pairs. Set value to 'null' (no quotes) to delete. Sorry, no IntelliSense

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent. This is processed before any overrides. Sorry, no IntelliSense

launches.name: use EXACT name of chained configuration to launch
launches.folder: use full path or folder basename or leave empty

graphConfig.description: Description of how graphing can be done. See our Wiki for details

annotate.description: Create annotations on the graph for when the target processor starts and stops execution. (green line for starting execution, red line for stopping execution).

plots.description: Plot configurations. Data sources must be configured for "graph" (or "advanced" with a decoder that sends graph data) in the "swoConfig" section

graphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the plot.

label.description: A label for this data set

timespan.description: Length of time (seconds) to be plotted on screen.
The amount of time (seconds) that the XY Plot will show the trace for.

xGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the X axis

yGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id Port for the Y axis

showDevDebugOutput.description: Used to debug this extension. Prints all GDB responses to the console. 'raw' prints gdb responses, 'parsed' prints results after parsing, 'both' prints both. 'vscode' shows raw and VSCode interactions

svdFile.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer'. It can be a simple file name or more based on a CMSIS pack or deviceName. See 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' for format

svdPath.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' and 'Embedded Tools' Extension from Microsoft. It can be a simple file name. For 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' or more based on a CMSIS pack or deviceName. See 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' for format

rttConfig.description: SEGGER's Real Time Trace (RTT) and supported by JLink, OpenOCD and perhaps others in the future

address.description: Address to start searching for the RTT control block. Use "auto" for Cortex-Debug to use the address from elf file

searchSize.description: Number of bytes to search for the RTT control block. If 'address' is 'auto', use ONLY if you have a custom RTT implementation

searchId.description: A string to search for to find the RTT control block. If 'address' is 'auto', use ONLY if you have a custom RTT implementation

polling_interval.description: number of milliseconds (> 0) to wait for check for data on out channels. Only for OpenOCD

rtt_start_retry.description: Keep trying to start RTT for OpenOCD until it succeeds with given internal in milliseconds. <= 0 means do not retry. Only for OpenOCD

clearSearch.description: When true, clears the search-string. Only applicable when address is "auto"

type.description: 'console' with text input/output, 'binary' is for converting byte stream to other data types

prompt.description: Prompt to use for RTT Console

noprompt.description: Don't use a prompt for RTT Console

noclear.description: append to screen/logfile when another connection is made

logfile.description: log all raw data (input and output) to specified file

timestamp.description: Add timestamps while printing for 'console' type. 'binary' type always prints timestamps

encoding.description: How binary data bytes are converted into a number. All little-endian

iencoding.description: How keyboard input is encoded. Cooked mode only

scale.description: Binary only: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

inputmode.description:
Experimental: 'disabled' means no stdin. 'raw' and 'rawecho' sends chars as they are typed.
'rawecho' will echo chars and process RETURN keys. Even CTRL-C CTRL-D are passed on

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoConfig.description: Description of SWO can be configured. Also see our Wiki for details

cpuFrequency.description: Target CPU frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

source.description: Source for SWO data. Can either be "probe" to get directly from debug probe, or a serial port device to use a serial port external to the debug probe.

swoPath.description: Path name when source is "file" or "serial". Typically a /path-name or a serial-port-name

swoPort.description: When server is "external" && source is "socket", port to connect to. Format [host:]port

label.description: A label for the output window.

showOnStartup.description: If true, switches to this output when starting a debug session.

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

label.description: A label for the output window.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoFrequency.description: SWO frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

ipAddress.description: IP Address for networked J-Link Adapter

serialNumber.description: J-Link or ST-LINK Serial Number - only needed if multiple J-Links/ST-LINKs are connected to the computer

interface.description: Debug Interface type to use for connections (defaults to SWD) - Used for J-Link, ST-LINK and BMP probes.

jlinkscript.description: J-Link script file - optional input file for customizing J-Link actions.

openOCDLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) after configuration files are loaded (-c options)

openOCDPreConfigLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) before configuration files are loaded (-c options)

configFiles.description: OpenOCD/PE GDB Server configuration file(s) to use when debugging (OpenOCD -f option)

searchDir.description: OpenOCD directories to search for config files and scripts (-s option). If no search directories are specified, it defaults to the configured cwd.

v1.description: For st-util only. Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1 (for example, the ST-Link on the STM32 VL Discovery is a V1 device). When set to false a ST-Link V2 device is used.

stlinkPath.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

stm32cubeprogrammer.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier (only needed for custom hardware)

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB Server. On Windows this will be "COM<num>", on Linux this will be something similar to /dev/ttyACM0, on OS X something like /dev/cu.usbmodemE2C0C4C6 (do not use tty versions on OS X)

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe. "powerOverBMP" : "enable" or "powerOverBMP" : "disable". If not set it will use the last power state.

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe, stlink, stutil, qemu, bmp and external. For "external", [please read our Wiki](https://github.com/Marus/cortex-debug/wiki/External-gdb-server-configuration)

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main launch sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main launch sequence has finished.

preRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the restart sequence (after interrupting execution).

postRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the restart sequence.

preResetCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the reset sequence (after interrupting execution). When not defined this will have the same value of preRestartCommands.

postResetCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the reset sequence. When not defined this will have the same value of postRestartCommands.

overrideLaunchCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of flashing and launching the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preLaunchCommands and postLaunchCommands to customize the GDB launch sequence.

overrideRestartCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of restarting the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preRestartCommands and postRestartCommands to customize the GDB restart sequence.

overrideResetCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of reset the target. When not defined this will have the same value of overrideRestartCommands. In most cases it is preferable to use preResetCommands and postResetCommands to customize the GDB reset sequence.

postStartSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the start sequence, after a debug session has already started and runToEntryPoint is not specified.

postRestartSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the re-start sequence, after a debug session has already started.

overrideGDBServerStartedRegex.description: You can supply a regular expression (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions) in the configuration property to override the output from the GDB Server that is looked for to determine if the GDB Server has started. Under most circumstances this will not be necessary - but could be needed as a result of a change in the output of a GDB Server making it incompatible with cortex-debug. This property has no effect for bmp or external GDB Server types.

cpu.description: CPU Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

machine.description: Machine Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

rtos.description: RTOS being used. For JLink this can be Azure, ChibiOS, embOS, FreeRTOS, NuttX, Zephyr or the path to a custom JLink RTOS Plugin library. For OpenOCD this can be auto (recommended), FreeRTOS, ThreadX, chibios, Chromium-EC, eCos, embKernel, linux, mqx, nuttx, RIOT, uCOS-III, or Zephyr.

armToolchainPath.description: This setting can be used to override the armToolchainPath user setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the path where arm-none-eabi-gdb, arm-none-eabi-objdump and arm-none-eabi-nm are located.

toolchainPrefix.description: This setting can be used to override the toolchainPrefix user setting for a particular launch configuration. Default = "arm-none-eabi"

serverpath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB Server path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. It is the full pathname to the executable or name of executable if it is in your PATH

gdbPath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the full pathname to the executable (or name of the executable if it is in your PATH). Note that other toolchain executables with the configured prefix must still be available.

objdumpPath.description: This setting can be used to override the objdump (used to find globals/statics) path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the full pathname to the executable (or name of the executable if it is in your PATH). Note that other toolchain executables with the configured prefix must still be available. The program 'nm' is also expected alongside

serverArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB Server command line

executable.description: Path of executable for symbols and program information. See also `loadFiles`, `symbolFiles`

loadFiles.description: List of files (hex/bin/elf files) to load/program instead of the executable file. Symbols are not loaded (see `symbolFiles`). Can be an empty list to specify none. If this property does not exist, then the executable is used to program the device

symbolFiles.description: List of ELF files to load symbols from instead of the executable file. Program information is ignored (see `loadFiles`). Can be an empty list to specify none. If this property does not exist, then the executable is used for symbols

file.description: Pathname of an ELF file for symbols

offset.description: Optional offset to apply to all sections of the ELF file. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

textaddress.description: Optional: Load the TEXT section at the specified 'textaddress'. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

address.description: Base address for section. Use a string strarting with '0x' for a hexadecimal number

gdbTarget.description: For externally (servertype = "external") controlled GDB Servers you must specify the GDB target to connect to. This can either be a "hostname:port" combination or path to a serial port

breakAfterReset.description: Applies to Restart/Reset/Launch, halt debugger after a reset. Ignored if `runToEntryPoint` is used.

runToEntryPoint.description: Applies to Launch/Restart/Reset, ignored for Attach. If enabled the debugger will run until the start of the given function.

numberOfProcessors.description: Number of processors/cores in the target device.

targetProcessor.description: The processor you want to debug. Zero based integer index. Must be less than 'numberOfProcessors'

liveWatch.description: An object with parameters for Live Watch

enabled.description: Enable/Disable Live Watch. Only applies to OpenOCD

samplesPerSecond.description: Maximum number of samples per second. Different from GUI refresh-rate, which is a user/workspace setting

enabled.description: Enable/Disable Cross Trigger Interface/Matrix for synchronized pause/resume

initCommands.description: List of OpenOCD TCL commands to initialize the CTI/CTM infrastructure (if any)

pauseCommands.description: List of OpenOCD TCL commands to pause all processors

resumeCommands.description: List of OpenOCD TCL commands to resume all processors

chainedConfigurations.description: An object describing how additional configurations should be launched

enabled.description: Enable/Disable entire set of chained configurations

detached.description: Related or independent server sessions. Set to true for servers like 'JLink'. Inherited by children

lifecycleManagedByParent.description: Are Restart/Reset/Stop/Disconnect shared? All life-cycle management done as a group by parent/root. Inherited by children

waitOnEvent.description: Event to wait for. 'postStart' means wait for gdb-server connecting, 'postInit' is after init commands are completed by gdb. Inherited by children

delayMs.description: Default delay in milliseconds for a certain amount of milliseconds to begin launch. Inherited by children

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration. A set of name/value pairs. Set value to 'null' (no quotes) to delete. Sorry, no IntelliSense

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent. Sorry, no IntelliSense

name.description: Name of launch configuration. Sorry, no IntelliSense

folder.description: Folder to use for this configuration. Where .vscode/launch.json exists. Default is same folder as parent. Use either the full path name or the base-name of the folder

detached.description: Related or independent server sessions. Set to true for servers like 'JLink'

waitOnEvent.description: Wait for an event. 'postStart' means wait for gdb-server connecting, 'postInit' is after init commands are completed by gdb

delayMs.description: Delay in milliseconds for a certain amount of milliseconds to begin launch

lifecycleManagedByParent.description: Are Restart/Reset/Stop/Disconnect shared? All life-cycle management done as a group by parent/root

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration. A set of name/value pairs. Set value to 'null' (no quotes) to delete. Sorry, no IntelliSense

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent. Sorry, no IntelliSense

launches.name: use EXACT name of chained configuration to launch
launches.folder: use full path or folder basename or leave empty

graphConfig.description: Description of how graphing can be done. See our Wiki for details

annotate.description: Create annotations on the graph for when the target processor starts and stops execution. (green line for starting execution, red line for stopping execution).

plots.description: Plot configurations. Data sources must be configured for "graph" (or "advanced" with a decoder that sends graph data) in the "swoConfig" section

graphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the plot.

label.description: A label for this data set

timespan.description: Length of time (seconds) to be plotted on screen.
The amount of time (seconds) that the XY Plot will show the trace for.

xGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the X axis

yGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id Port for the Y axis

showDevDebugOutput.description: Used to debug this extension. Prints all GDB responses to the console. 'raw' prints gdb responses, 'parsed' prints results after parsing, 'both' prints both. 'vscode' shows raw and VSCode interactions

svdFile.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer'. It can be a simple file name or more based on a CMSIS pack or deviceName. See 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' for format

svdPath.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' and 'Embedded Tools' Extension from Microsoft. It can be a simple file name. For 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' or more based on a CMSIS pack or deviceName. See 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' for format

rttConfig.description: SEGGER's Real Time Trace (RTT) and supported by JLink, OpenOCD and perhaps others in the future

address.description: Address to start searching for the RTT control block. Use "auto" for Cortex-Debug to use the address from elf file

searchSize.description: Number of bytes to search for the RTT control block. If 'address' is 'auto', use ONLY if you have a custom RTT implementation

searchId.description: A string to search for to find the RTT control block. If 'address' is 'auto', use ONLY if you have a custom RTT implementation

polling_interval.description: number of milliseconds (> 0) to wait for check for data on out channels. Only for OpenOCD

rtt_start_retry.description: Keep trying to start RTT for OpenOCD until it succeeds with given internal in milliseconds. <= 0 means do not retry. Only for OpenOCD

clearSearch.description: When true, clears the search-string. Only applicable when address is "auto"

type.description: 'console' with text input/output, 'binary' is for converting byte stream to other data types

prompt.description: Prompt to use for RTT Console

noprompt.description: Don't use a prompt for RTT Console

noclear.description: append to screen/logfile when another connection is made

logfile.description: log all raw data (input and output) to specified file

timestamp.description: Add timestamps while printing for 'console' type. 'binary' type always prints timestamps

encoding.description: How binary data bytes are converted into a number. All little-endian

iencoding.description: How keyboard input is encoded Cooked mode only

scale.description: Binary only: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

inputmode.description:
Experimental: 'disabled' means no stdin. 'raw' and 'rawecho' sends chars as they are typed.
'rawecho' will echo chars and process RETURN keys. Even CTRL-C CTRL-D are passed on

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoConfig.description: Description of SWO can be configured. Also see our Wiki for details

source.description: Source for SWO data. Can either be "probe" to get directly from debug probe, or a serial port device to use a serial port external to the debug probe.

swoPath.description: Path name when source is "file" or "serial". Typically a /path-name or a serial-port-name

swoPort.description: When server is "external" && source is "socket", port to connect to. Format [host:]port

label.description: A label for the output window.

showOnStartup.description: If true, switches to this output when starting a debug session.

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

label.description: A label for the output window.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

ipAddress.description: IP Address for networked J-Link Adapter

serialNumber.description: J-Link or ST-LINK Serial Number - only needed if multiple J-Links/ST-LINKs are connected to the computer

interface.description: Debug Interface type to use for connections (defaults to SWD) - Used for J-Link, ST-LINK and BMP probes.

jlinkscript.description: J-Link script file - optional input file for customizing J-Link actions.

openOCDLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) after configuration files are loaded (-c options)

openOCDPreConfigLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) before configuration files are loaded (-c options)

configFiles.description: OpenOCD/PE GDB Server configuration file(s) to use when debugging (OpenOCD -f option)

searchDir.description: OpenOCD directories to search for config files and scripts (-s option). If no search directories are specified, it defaults to the configured cwd.

v1.description: For st-util only. Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1 (for example, the ST-Link on the STM32 VL Discovery is a V1 device). When set to false a ST-Link V2 device is used.

stlinkPath.description: Path to the ST-LINK_gdbserver executable. If not set then ST-LINK_gdbserver (ST-LINK_gdbserver.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

stm32cubeprogrammer.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier (only needed for custom hardware)

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB Server. On Windows this will be "COM<num>", on Linux this will be something similar to /dev/ttyACM0, on OS X something like /dev/cu.usbmodemE2C0C4C6 (do not use tty versions on OS X)

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe. "powerOverBMP" : "enable" or "powerOverBMP" : "disable". If not set it will use the last power state.

configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + JLink
configurationSnippets.label: Cortex Debug: JLink

configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + OpenOCD
configurationSnippets.label: Cortex Debug: OpenOCD

configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + STMicroelectronic's ST-LINK_gdbserver part of STM32CubeIDE
configurationSnippets.label: Cortex Debug: ST-LINK

configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + PyOCD
configurationSnippets.label: Cortex Debug: PyOCD

configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + Texane's st-util GDB Server (https://github.com/texane/stlink)
configurationSnippets.label: Cortex Debug: ST-Util

view/title.when: view == workbench.debug.variablesView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.variablesView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped && !cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.watchExpressionsView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.watchExpressionsView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped && !cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == cortex-debug.liveWatch && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == cortex-debug.liveWatch && inDebugMode && debugType == 'cortex-debug' && debugState == stopped && !cortex-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat

description: ARM Cortex-M GDB Debugger support for VSCode
name: cortex-debug
